definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
to nibble away at (as silkworm consume leaves)/fig. to embezzle progressively
Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]

sentences.english: He carelessly knocked over the silkworm tray, leaving the floor covered with folia mori.
sentences.chinese: 他一不小心打翻了蚕匾，桑叶散满了一地。

sentences.english: They increased their income by raising silkworms and so on.
sentences.chinese: 他们靠饲养蚕等增加了收入。

sentences.english: As a clan of being skilled in sericulture, Can Cong clan was named after silkworm.
sentences.chinese: 蚕丛氏作为擅长养蚕制丝的部族，即以蚕而得名。

sentences.english: It is, in its long development, inseparable from silkworm-raising and silk-reeling and weaving.
sentences.chinese: 刺绣的长期发展离不开蚕的养殖和纺丝技术的发展。

sentences.english: The value of the sericulture culture is the base of sericulture economy of modern days.
sentences.chinese: 认清蚕文化的价值是振兴当代蚕业经济的基础。

sentences.english: Premature crystallization would clog up their silk glands, which would likely prove fatal to the little creatures.
sentences.chinese: 而过早的结晶会阻塞丝腺，蚕很可能为此丧命。

sentences.english: During Neolithic Period, people have already begun breeding silkworm and producing silk.
sentences.chinese: 新石器时代，蚕的养殖和丝绸的生产，就已经开始了。

sentences.english: Called a" muscular pouch" folk is generally referred to as " lying silkworm . "
sentences.chinese: 称叫“肌性眼袋”，民间一般称之为“幄蚕”。

sentences.english: “The advantage of silkworms is that they’re easy to grow, ” Dr. Hayashi said.
sentences.chinese: “蚕的优势在于容易养殖，”哈亚希博士说。

sentences.english: Eventually, silkworms were found in many areas throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 最后，在世界的许多地方都能找到蚕。

sentences.english: Si-chuan province is one of the major silk producing areas in China.
sentences.chinese: 四川省是我国蚕丝绸主产区之一。

sentences.english: Male silkworm are more survivable and higher silk -yielding than the female.
sentences.chinese: 雄蚕较雌蚕有较高的生命力和叶丝转化率。

sentences.english: The results showed that the transgenic silkworm strain of anti NPV ribozyme has been got.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果表明已经获得了抗NPV的核酶转基因蚕。

sentences.english: “The advantage of silkworms is that they’re easy to grow,” Dr. Hayashi said.
sentences.chinese: “蚕的优势在于容易养殖，”哈亚希博士说。

definition: (of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
arch. legendary venomous insect/to poison/to bewitch/to drive to insanity/to harm by witchcraft/intestinal parasite
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
